description: Exposed wiring must be enclosed in conduit in areas accessible to people.
All exits and emergency paths must be clearly marked and unobstructed.
Employers must take action to eliminate workplace hazards immediately.
Lighting levels must be appropriate for the task performed.
Fire extinguishers must be inspected and maintained regularly.
Concrete structures must be designed to withstand expected loads.
Steel structures must be designed for durability and stability.
Reinforcing steel must meet specified strength and ductility requirements.
Glass used in buildings must be properly glazed and secured.
Design of buildings must provide access for people with disabilities.
Plumbing systems must be designed to prevent contamination.
Fire-resistance levels of building elements must be determined.
Construction of buildings in bushfire-prone areas must comply with specific requirements.
Structural design actions must consider dead and live loads.
Wind actions must be considered in structural design.
Earthquake actions must be considered in structural design.
Fire hazard properties of materials must be determined.
Building elements must be constructed to resist bushfire attack.
Emergency plans must be developed and implemented.
Workplace hazards must be identified and assessed.
Lighting levels for indoor workspaces must meet specified requirements.
Fire protection systems must be tested and maintained regularly.
Concrete mix design must comply with specified requirements.
Steel structures must be fabricated and erected according to specified standards.
Reinforcing steel must be properly handled and stored.
Glass must be properly installed to ensure safety.
Doorways and passages must be designed for accessibility.
Plumbing systems must be installed to prevent backflow.
Fire-resistance levels must be maintained during construction.
Building elements must be constructed to resist bushfire attack.
